intro: Trachysperma nutans, commonly known as the mountain clover, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its legume fruits and nitrogen-fixing abilities. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Its small, trifoliate leaves and pea-like flowers contribute to its ornamental value. Trachysperma nutans is often used in ecological restoration projects due to its hardiness and ability to thrive in poor soil conditions.
